analytic.title: A Unified Near-Optimal Estimator For Dimension Reduction in l α (0 < α ≤ 2) Using Stable Random Projections

abstract.p: Many tasks (e.g., clustering) in machine learning only require the l α distances instead of the original data. For dimension reductions in the l α norm (0 < α ≤ 2), the method of stable random projections can efficiently compute the l α distances in massive datasets (e.g., the Web or massive data streams) in one pass of the data. The estimation task for stable random projections has been an interesting topic. We propose a simple estimator based on the fractional power of the samples (pro-jected data), which is surprisingly near-optimal in terms of the asymptotic variance. In fact, it achieves the Cramér-Rao bound when α = 2 and α = 0+. This new result will be useful when applying stable random projections to distance-based clustering, classifications, kernels, massive data streams etc.
